title: How to Become a Gold Dealer

steps.title: Decide what kind of gold to buy.
steps.content: Decide what kind of gold to buy. You may decide to purchase scrap gold, jewelry or coins.

steps.title: Research the competition.
steps.content: Research the competition. Check out the competition both in your geographic area and on online auction sites. Your will want to look for what the competition isn’t offering so that you can provide your customers with unique value.

steps.title: Develop a business plan.
steps.content: Develop a business plan. [1] X Research source Write an executive summary for your business. This is a concise statement of the business’s purpose. Include a more detailed description of the business, including marketing plans, competition assessment, operating procedures, personnel, and an insurance summary. Compile your financial data. If you have no business history, create statements to project your revenue. Assemble all supporting documents. This includes a copy of your lease if you plan to use a storefront, your tax returns, your licenses and legal documents, and the resumes of your personnel.

steps.title: Obtain financing for your business if needed.
steps.content: Obtain financing for your business if needed. Talk to a loan officer from your local bank or credit union about your loan options, and bring your business plan with you.

steps.title: Learn to test the quality of gold.
steps.content: Learn to test the quality of gold. Test gold with a magnet. Gold does not have magnetic properties. Test gold with a fine steel file. Gold is easy to file, but the file will bounce off of other metals. Purchase acids for testing. Follow the instructions on the package to test the gold for genuineness, testing in an inconspicuous spot to prevent visible damage.

steps.title: Follow market prices.
steps.content: Follow market prices. You can find the daily market prices of gold on many brokerage websites.

steps.title: Obtain a scale.
steps.content: Obtain a scale. You will need to purchase a jeweler’s scale that weighs gold according to pennyweight (1/12 of a troy ounce) rather than simply weighing gold in grams.

steps.title: Buy gold from customers.
steps.content: Buy gold from customers. Many customers are happy to sell their gold jewelry and coins to a respectable dealer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase gold at trade shows.
steps.content: Purchase gold at trade shows. Many dealers at a trade show will give a price break to someone who is just getting started in the business.

steps.title: Purchase gold in large volumes.
steps.content: Purchase gold in large volumes. Large volume purchases tend to have a lower price per ounce. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Market your business.
steps.content: Market your business. Try online advertising or search engine marketing by contacting a marketing expert or by using Google Ads. Advertise in respected trade publications like Gold World. Advertise in your local newspaper or online news portal.

steps.title: Choose your premium.
steps.content: Choose your premium. You may choose to charge between 1 and 5 percent of the value of the gold for each sale. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Decide whether or not you want to negotiate prices with customers.
steps.content: Decide whether or not you want to negotiate prices with customers. Many customers enjoy the negotiation process, but you can decide whether or not you want to bargain.

steps.title: Consider becoming an Authorized Purchaser with the United States Mint.
steps.content: Consider becoming an Authorized Purchaser with the United States Mint. This lends your business an air of authority, but the requirements you must meet are a bit strict: Have a business net worth of at least $25 million for the past 3 years. Be in business for 5 years or longer. Become certified by a CPA who is a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants.
